photo.description: "El Castillo" in Chichen Itza in 1975, scan from a Kodachrome Diapositive with a Rollei DF-S 100 SE. I did some color/contrast adaption with the Gimp...

photo.title: 365 Steps

photo.description: Chichen Itza's great ball court stretches about 500 foot long and had two hoops (one on each side) that were at least 20 foot in the air. The goal was to put a six pound rubber ball through them to win the game. Oh, and no hands please. By the way, they were playing for the honor of being sacrificed to the gods. Yes, the winning captain lost his head when the game ended. No wonder the games lasted so long.
photo.tags: 2010 nov vacation cancun wedding bev david chichenitza tour great ballcourt ball court sport mexico
photo.title: The "Sport Court"

photo.description: Western staircase of El Castillo (24m high, 800AD), Chichen Itza, Mexico The staircase has 91 steps, so all four sides together are 365 steps - the number of days in a year. The pyramid is dedicated to the god Kukulcan.
photo.tags: 24105 ef24105mmf4lisusm canoneos5dmarkii chichenitza f11 yucatán canon méxico kukulcan pisté elcastillo mexico hdr yucatan
photo.title: El Castillo

photo.description: this is the rail that is lit up in a special way only once a year. On the spring solstice, the sun hits exactly the right angle to put light and shadow across this rail to make it look like the serpent is coming down the stairs
photo.tags: 2010 nov vacation cancun wedding bev david chichenitza tour mexico pyramid
photo.title: Serpant rail

photo.description: Western staircase of El Castillo (24m high, 800AD), Chichen Itza, Mexico The staircase has 91 steps, so all four sides together are 365 steps - the number of days in a year. The pyramid is dedicated to the god Kukulcan.
